name: perfidiously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that cannot be trusted, or that shows no loyalty: The two countries promised, perhaps perfidiously, to stop supporting each other's rebels. Someone on the team had perfidiously leaked details of the plan to the other side.
More examplesFewer examplesHe claimed they had perfidiously betrayed their country and strengthened the enemy.The Soviet spy spent a perfidiously productive decade at a high rank in Cold War British intelligence.The nature of modern life means that cyber-criminals have the potential to target individuals perfidiously.
